Astrology is your journey, and nobody can tell you what your relationship with the stars is.

title: An amazing app gone wrong.
text: This app used to be amazing but it is now essentially “bricked” and even the most basic features are completely locked making the app useless. $9.00 a month for an ai astrology service is insane, I understand that it delves deep and offers a beautifully aesthetic & creative tool… I just can’t justify that price point ethically speaking. If it were perhaps $2.99 (As most news/journalism apps) it would be completely reasonable given the features it provides, However, I can get much more in depth readings & quality from other ai service like grok (for example) who uses the same NASA data and much more sourced information minus the social element (which I didn’t really use anyway.) I appreciate what this app accomplished when it was free with half of the features, But now that another company decided to go down the same greed-driven subscription based model as the rest of the App Store. I’m going have to simply opt out. If the price point doesn’t bother you, I will say this is an adoring app that has many cute quirks & features (as well as it being aesthetically pleasing)… It’s simply a hard pass for me. Sorry Co-Star we had a good run — But this is just not the vibe in this current economy and I wish the best on your endeavors. If it went back to its previous iteration before this huge update recently, Atleast allowing half of the daily horoscope available (and the ability to use the widget without the subscription as previously functioned) maybe I’d come back. But $9?? Oof, No thank you.😒

title: Oddly negative
text: I assume Costar’s “horoscopes” were created to help users process their day before, during, and after it happens while providing themes and solutions that may help you improve your outcomes in life. However, my horoscopes are usually highly vague and disheartening. Very random, pretentious, nonsensical, and odd unnecessary callouts. I appreciate the poetic writing, but most of the time it just makes zero sense? For example, Today I had a great productive, confident day — yet this app told me I’d have “trouble” with each area of my life (including: routine, thinking & creativity, spirituality, social life, seggs and love, and self!) This happens often. The horoscope is almost never accurate. The only reason I keep redownloading it after deleting it is because of its cool aesthetics and ACTUALLY useful and accurate birth chart readings. So sadly, the paid features seem to be the best bet rather than the free ones. Not that great of a tool for casual astrologers.

text: *2025 UPDATE BELOW* …I’ve grown up with astrology all of my life, my father and his fiancé are both astrologists. What makes this app even cooler is being able to invite your friends&family to join and then see the compatibility between you&them. I LOVE IT! March 2025 UPDATE: My first review is many years old before the newer & certainly the best features were added, as it was written when the app had only recently come out. BEFORE the app was available on Android. The personalized charts such as Your Relationship Analysis had been able to put into eloquent words what I had been feeling & seeing the patterns of myself for 20+ years without the ability to relay it to others. I only pay for a few apps monthly (YT, Apple Music, Human Design & THIS).

I’m sure they will just move the goal posts if they respond to me, but it is clear they are trying to hoodwink the below average thinker, or do they believe their own nonsense. Astrology is vague nonsense and I worry for those saying it is “scarily accurate”, they are ripe to be a victim of a Ponzi scheme.

title: Repetitive horoscopes & always negative
text: In my quest for celestial insights, I turned to Co-Star, an app that promised a tailored astrological experience. Unfortunately, my journey through the stars with Co-Star has been anything but personalized. Day after day, I am presented with readings that echo yesterday's words—a monotonous repetition that offers no new wisdom or reflection. The app's insistence on highlighting non-existent spiritual troubles is particularly baffling. It claims I'm at odds with my spirituality, yet I stand firm and content on my spiritual path. This repetitive narrative not only undermines the app's credibility but also my trust in its ability to provide unique and insightful guidance. The beauty of astrology lies in its personal touch, the nuanced readings that resonate on a deeper level. Co-Star, however, seems to have missed the mark, delivering a generic experience that could apply to anyone. To the developers of Co-Star, I urge you to consider the individuality of your users. We seek connections with the cosmos that reflect our personal journeys, not a one-size-fits-all approach that leaves us questioning the app's understanding of the stars. In conclusion, Co-Star has been a letdown. It has failed to live up to its promise of personalization and has instead left me with a sense of disconnection from the celestial guidance I sought. One can only hope that future updates will bring about the change needed to make Co-Star a truly stellar companion.

The interaction between the more complex aspects of a person’s full chart, are what make this type of “reading”or access to astrology based information a huge asset to any individual! So many people who think astrology is “ generic”, or “fake” would likely be shocked at how personal it gets when you look at the whole chart and have guidance or guidelines for how to interpret it and apply it to your life. This app offers both chart and table placements as visual aids, has accurate and consistently updated personalized astrology based information in relation to current planetary alignments, and where they were compared to the exact day and time of your birth. text: Before the last update it seems like the dos and don’ts were generated from highlighting a specific transit that was most exact that day. I know some people think they’re random, but as someone who’s studied astrology I enjoyed them as ways of embodying energies of a transit and figuring out if they were meant to enhance or mitigate that energy (like, for instance, taking a cold shower during a difficult Mars transit), and found it really grounding and inspiring as a daily/weekly practice. Now it isn’t clear what transit the dos and don’ts are referring to, and it’s laborious for me to comb through the entire daily update (which is often repetitive and confusing) to figure it out. title: A Beginner's Delight: Costarastrology.com's Engaging Horoscope Experience
text: As someone who is new to the world of in-depth horoscopes, stumbling upon Costarastrology.com great find. The website is refreshingly simple and easy to navigate, extensive horoscope content, and the icing on the cake - the fact that they offer this service for free. In a world where premium astrology platforms are commonplace, this generous gesture is a breath of fresh air. It allows curious newcomers like myself to further explore horoscope readings without financial constraints, fostering a sense of accessibility and inclusivity. While I understand that the website also offers additional premium membership features and benefits, the fact that the core horoscope content remains freely accessible is commendable.

title: Don’t download this app
text: I like astrology, like a lot of astrology girls out there, I was looking for an app where I could see my natal chart and have accurate daily horoscopes designed to fit all my placements. I’d seen Co-star before and I knew it was notorious for being pretty quirky with their readings which is why I picked it over other apps, It had nice graphics and starting out it was pretty legit! I used it for a long time, got my friends and family to use it, not noticing how slowly my horoscopes were becoming more and more grim as time went on. Eventually I wanted to pay for the in depth love reading because, being single and happy, I thought it would be super lighthearted and fun. I was wrong :D. “No matter what you’ve told yourself, you are not a victim.” Are you kidding me? Literally quoting part of what that overly-negative, borderline hateful horoscope read. I really hope other people who got the same reading I did didn’t read into it at all because if I didn’t know any better it would have made me really upset. In my personal experience, I don’t think it’s normal for readings to come off as negative as this app approaches it, it’s unnecessarily harsh. Don’t buy into it, don’t download it, it’s not worth the negativity.

title: The only astrology app I recommend to newbies!
text: This is my number one app I recommend to friends and family and coworkers who are starting to dive into astrology, I love how it gives you a very direct breakdown of your chart signs in a way that’s relatable, understandable, and not overwhelming! I like the daily horoscopes as well and notifications it pushes each day. Honestly all the other features I don’t pay much attention to, everything else feels like fluff that’s used to just added to the app that’s not really needed. I paid for the relationship stuff with my partner and while it was fun for a week or two we didn’t get any closer than a blunt and journaling couldn’t have done. I do like how they implemented the new AI chat bot but it’s a little gimmicky and cash grabby. I’d rather do tarot or something because knowing it’s just rebranded AI doesn’t feel authentic. But the core concept of the app and the chart, explanations, and horoscopes each day are hard to beat and are what brings me back each day. I’m sure there’s more advanced stuff out there that’ll dive into the more nuances of your chart like planet positions and nodes but this app gives exactly what you *need* in an easily consumable package that’s perfect for beginners.

text: Did the update, no FB login anymore (which is fine, I don’t do FB anymore anyway)… but it asks for your phone number. The place to enter it says, as an example number CASH NOW. I noticed it, thought oops, backed up and entered the correct number… it sent me a code, but the app itself said “invalid phone number.” I tried again, got the code texted to me, but the app said “invalid phone number.” Now it no longer gives me the prompt for the phone number takes me right into the app. I assume my account is now associated with someone else’s number. title: Interesting
text: To believe or not to believe…? That’s the question, but for me, it’s entertaining, interesting and insightful in ways that make me want to understand traits of who I am with the insight I get from the app. I take what resonates and feels right and altogether, I still don’t know how to “meditate”, but the daily messages definitely marinate in my mind and I like to think about those messages as a little tool from the universe that for some reason, it wants me to know because otherwise, I’d probably miss that special message or “seed” that’ll germinate at its due time. So all in all, really cool app, I’m happy to have encountered it and it’s something I look forward to daily. *Note* sometimes, messages feel like they’ve been told many times before, just worded differently in some instances, but either way, it’s good enough variation and “repetition” of interesting content that makes me feel good. Okay bye! ❤️
